scheme_name: A Program to Provide 90 Percent Assistance in Planting Material of Horticultural Fruit Crops
nodal_department: Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department
brief_description: This scheme offers 90% financial assistance to farmers for purchasing planting materials of fruit crops to promote horticulture.
detailed_description: &quot;A Program to Provide 90 Percent Assistance in Planting Material of Horticultural Fruit Crops&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to support farmers by providing 90% subsidy on the cost of planting materials like grafted/tissue culture saplings and seedlings for various fruit crops.
benefits: Farmers receive up to 90% financial assistance on the cost of planting materials. Pre-fixed assistance rates per hectare for different crops:

Fruit | Assistance
Mango | ₹32,000/ha
Sapota (Chiku) | ₹22,000/ha
Pomegranate | ₹20,000/ha
Guava | ₹16,650/ha
Aonla (Indian Gooseberry) | ₹5,560/ha
Mandarin / Orange | ₹5,560/ha
Ber | ₹2,780/ha
Coconut | ₹13,000/ha

Only saplings costing up to ₹250/- per unit are eligible for subsidy. For fruit crops and cuttings: Planting material will have to be purchased from nurseries accredited by NHB/Agricultural University/Horticulture Department. For coconut crops: seedlings prepared from seeds will have to be purchased from nurseries accredited by NHB/Agricultural University/Horticulture Department.  For tissue culture: Planting material (planting) will have to be purchased from tissue labs approved/accredited by DBT, GNFC, GSFC, Tissue Labs of Agricultural University, Government Public Institutions like
eligibility_criteria: The applicant must be a farmer. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. The applicant must purchase planting materials from approved/accredited sources.

steps: Step 1: The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/  Step 2: On the home page, click on ‘Schemes' and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes'. Step 3: Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply' button and an application page will open. Step 4: Click on "Apply New" button and submit a new application. Step 5: Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application. Step 6: Once the application is done, confirm it. Step 7: Take a print out of the confirmed application. Step 8: Applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx  Contact Us:  Click here .

documents_required: 7/12 Certificate (land ownership proof). Aadhaar Card. Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque.
